about.name: Structured LLM Output
about.description: Converting unstructured Large Language Model responses into typed, validated JSON data structures

audience.audienceType: Developers, AI Engineers, Product Teams, Startups

useCases.name: Text Classification
useCases.description: Classify text into predefined categories with confidence scores. Use cases include sentiment analysis, content moderation, and intent detection.

useCases.name: Data Extraction
useCases.description: Extract structured data from unstructured text. Parse receipts, extract entities from documents, normalize addresses and contact information.

useCases.name: Content Generation
useCases.description: Generate structured content like product descriptions, metadata, SEO tags, or formatted responses with guaranteed schema compliance.

useCases.name: Form Validation
useCases.description: Use AI understanding to validate and normalize user input, handling edge cases that rule-based validation cannot.

faq.question: What is {{VITE_APP_NAME}}?
faq.answer: {{VITE_APP_NAME}} is a platform that transforms unstructured LLM (Large Language Model) outputs into reliable, type-safe REST APIs. You define your output format using JSON Schema, and {{VITE_APP_NAME}} ensures the LLM response matches that structure.

faq.question: Which LLM providers does {{VITE_APP_NAME}} support?
faq.answer: {{VITE_APP_NAME}} supports OpenAI (GPT-4, GPT-3.5), Anthropic (Claude 3, Claude 2), Google (Gemini Pro, Gemini Ultra), and any custom LM server with an OpenAI-compatible API.

faq.question: How does structured output work?
faq.answer: You define a JSON Schema for your desired output format. {{VITE_APP_NAME}} uses advanced prompt engineering to instruct the LLM to return data matching your schema, then validates the response before returning it to you.

faq.question: Is there a free tier?
faq.answer: Yes, {{VITE_APP_NAME}} offers a free tier with limited requests. Paid plans are available for higher usage limits, multiple projects, and priority support.

faq.question: Do I need to handle prompt engineering?
faq.answer: No, {{VITE_APP_NAME}} handles the prompt engineering for you. You provide the instructions and context for what you want the LLM to do, and {{VITE_APP_NAME}} constructs the optimal prompt to get structured output.
